name: Club Med Sandpiper Bay

reviews.text: Like several other people, we booked our trip before finding this sight. If I had seen it first, I might never have booked it. We traveled with our 3 children 11,8 and 6. We also came with close family friends with children the exact same ages. The minute the shuttle dropped us off and we saw the surrondings and rooms I was in tears (keep reading..it gets better). It seemed to me that I was visiting a local park and the rooms were kept up as well as a public restroom! Ok..the rooms were huge I will give them that.....but, there was dust 3 inches thick in the walk in closet cubbies where I was suppose to put all of the clothes. The tub had a ring of mold around it and so did the shower curtain. My friend's room next door had the same problem plus her lock didn't work on the door. I didn't come with high expectiations...I long ago gave up thinking "The Ritz" I didn't' mind that the decor was outdated and ugly or that the floor was tile but I found it TOTALLY unreasonable that the place wasn't clean. At that minute, If I could have gotten our money back I would have left on the spot! The head manager was "out of town" all week and I spend the next day or two speaking with various "managers of the day" All foreign, all sweet and all clueless. We did get the room cleaned 3 times that first afternoon and they did scrape off the mold and replace the shower curtain....things were looking up.
reviews.title: READ THIS ONE!!!

reviews.text: By day two I stopped crying and started to chill out. When we checked in nobody gave us a list of things to do or where to go to sign the children up for camps. The resort seemed dead (We came on a Sat) until Monday rolled around. Things got rolling them and we found our way somehow. Our kids were not big into going to the camps. We should have set the precendent very early that they had to go for at least a few hours each day. They did LOVE LOVE LOVE the circus area and did the trapeze day after day. They also enjoyed sailing and rollerblading. I cannot say enough about the GO's (20 something couselors) that were absolutely wonderful!! They were amazing and took great care of the kids. Honestly, if you are looking for a vacation where you can drop your kids off at 9am and not pick them up until 5:30 then this is the place for you. Soooo many people did this, especially with the 2-7 year old crowd. We however, kept our kids out alot and they were very happy to go between the pool and one of the various sandboxes (who needs the beach, right?)
reviews.title: go if you can get a good deal -- otherwise, not worth $$$$$$$$

reviews.text: The food was great and there was tons!!! Most meals it was the same thing but each day they added a "theme" with some interesting dishes. Lots of fresh fruits, salads, fish, chicken, etc with lots and lots of kids choices.
reviews.title: Wonderful Family Vacation

reviews.text: Each night they had a different "thing" going on. Poker night, Trapeze show, talent show..they were all awesome and all incoorporated the kids.
reviews.title: Great family vacation at the Sandpiper

reviews.text: Soooo, with that said our kids had a blast!!! I can honestly say that I am happy we stayed. This place is in need of a TOTAL RENOVATION. I don't think I would ever go again ( I am need of luxury a little bit more....) However, we met people who have been coming back every spring break for the years. Truly, this resort is for people whose kids are interested in going into the kids clubs so their parents can have a break all day long!
reviews.title: Great for families, not so for singles.

reviews.text: My husband and two children, 3 and 1 went to C.M. Sandpiper in July for 8 days. We were satisfied with the room, though there were small ants. There is no mini bar fill up anymore. The food was very good; high chairs were always available. A stroller was provided from the hotel, which was great. What really surprised me and completely disappointed me were the lack of activities provided for children not in the kids' club. The kids' clubs did not work for my children at all, so there was absolutely nothing for my children to do on this vacation. There was not even a wading pool. If you do not pay for your children to use the kids' clubs, then you cannot use any of their services. So without the kids' clubs, it is not a kid-friendly environment. My husband and I have travelled a lot, and this hotel is extremely overrated. The absolute worst part was the man-made "beach". It looks nice in pictures, but it is repulsive!! There are 'snake-fish' (I don't remember the name) everywhere, and I've been told they bite! I would never swim in the swamp or dare put my children in it. We rented a car ($50.) and went to Bathtub beach--very nice for children. Nothing is within walking distance...you have to rent a car to do anything. There is ZERO nightlife at this hotel. Very boring. Overall, not too impressive. Go somewhere else!!
reviews.title: Not so great for kids

likes.liked: — Food was good, staff was friendly.
likes.disliked: — No beach, all water sports very pricey, no wading pool, no nightlife.

reviews.title: It was Ok

Dining still great at club Med after staying there for a week our next meal out of the resort tasting really bad.

reviews.text: Overall it was great, the kids loved it as usual, I didn't like staying there in early august it was too crowded, I recommend going end of August if you can.

reviews.title: Tolerable, which is much less than what I paid for

reviews.text: We had the worst trip at CM Sandpiper. We left after 1 day. There were less than 50 people in the whole resort when we were there, so they reduced the amount of amenities (a loud musical was the only option for dinner and my baby would not let us stay). The 1 bar had incense lit every 5 to 10 feet so I could not stay inside. There were ants and other bugs in our old room, and we saw 2 rats running across the rafters in the restaurant. There were so few people the staff though they were on vacation and were not helpful. We left and lost all of our money because the hotel does not handle the money - they refer you to Club Med in Arizona. After 1 month I finally spoke with someone and all they would do is give me a couple hundred dollars of credit at club med - like I'm ever going back!
reviews.title: Old resort, bad staff, lots of bugs and rats

reviews.text: It might be an OK trip for you, but if you have problems don't expect any chance for recourse.
reviews.title: Hated To Leave; Can't Wait to Return

likes.liked: — Wonderful staff, never leaving the resort and childcare
likes.disliked: — Housekeeping, would have prefered to be closer inside the village

reviews.text: I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews but I didn't find this site until a couple of days before we left. If I had read some of these reviews before booking I wouldn't have gone there and we would have missed what was truly the best vacation of our 8 year marriage. Our two boys (13 months and 5 years old) were entertained and doted upon by the GOs as if they had known them their entire lives. My five year old made instant friends and got to try things that we would never have paid for if they had been separate (5yr olds always want to try everything but as soon as they get there FORGET it). Perfect example, the trapeze, he was so excited before we left, then saw it and wanted no part of it, by Friday he changed his mind and decided he had to do it.

reviews.text: The baby was cared for according to his home schedule of naps and feedings. Every time I checked on him (he doesn't walk so he was a Peanut), someone was holding him or playing with him. He has never been in daycare and yet never had an issue being left with the GOs in the AM and picked up at 5.

reviews.text: Food is Amazing and luckily is balanced by the amount of walking and activity. The pace is actually very unhurried there since there are a lot of things to do but they are pretty much open every day so you don't feel like you have to cram sailing, tennis, golf... all into one day. My husband played golf in the morning and I took lessons then we would meet for lunch and each afternoon did something different (rollerblading one day, rock climbing the next, lounging by the pool the third day...).
reviews.title: Old, rundown and dirty

reviews.text: I am a little late writing this review. We visited Club Med in September 2006. Well this was the first trip traveling with our then 10 month old son. The reason why we picked Club med was because of the excellent kids club, and I have to say we were very pleased with the level of care they provided our little one.
reviews.title: Great Babies Club- Older Facility, Moms point of view!

reviews.text: They have tons of activities for littles ones and adults. My son has severe food allergies and food was properly labeled and I had no worries once I explained the details to the GOs. The night life is a little dead, but if you are there to relax you will have a ball! The gift shops prices are out of this world, so bring everything you need. Walmart is about 5 miles away if you forget something. One negative thing that we experienced on the first night is I saw a ROACH by the fruit in the restaurant. The manager saw it too and used a basket to cover it up. I was so GROSSED out, and I was so shocked that I did not confront her on it. I wish I did! So the question remains was it a Roach or a beetle or palmetto bug. I live in FL and know the Palmetto bugs run ramped in the summer. Needless to say I prayed each time I ate, avoided the fruit area, which was hard because I love fruit. I am happy to say that I did not see anymore bugs the rest of the trip! Other that that the food was good.
reviews.title: Club Med Sandpiper - a dream family vacation!

likes.liked: — It was spacious, huge closets, patio, great views

reviews.text: My mom, my sister, and I go to this Club Med every summer as a vacation. I absolutely love it! My mom is able to relax and bathe by the pool or lake, while my sister, who is 15, and I, who am 14, are able to hang out with kids our age. The sports are incredible... our whole family is very into waterskiing and the trapeze. The G.O.'s are excellent teachers, and they are all so friendly! We have been going to this Club Med for 8 years, and once you go, you'll understand why!

This Club Med looks a bit old. The rooms are clean and basic. My room had mold in the bathtub all over the corking. The food is is good to average. The staff is nice but at times there was confusion. It seems the entire staff is about 19 years old. The staff kept saying sorry. I have only been here for a few weeks and I am in training. It would be nice if someone at the front desk at a clue as to what was going on.

reviews.text: Based on the mixed reviews appearing on this site we embarked on our Sanpiper trip with only moderate expectations for this resort. Sadly, that low threshold was not met.

Just got back from a 7 night vacation with my family on Saturday and can’t say enough about Club Med Sandpiper. Like a previous poster stated, after reading these reviews I went on vacation to Sandpiper with much trepidation, all for not. Yes, the rooms are a bit worn, but are certainly just fine for vacation purposes.
reviews.title: Loved Club Med Sandpiper - Great Family Vacation

reviews.text: Mini Club
reviews.title: Better Than Expected

reviews.text: I can’t say enough about the wonderful Mini Club staff, my daughter is 14 months and walking, therefore, she was a Rascal. The GO’s in the daycare are outstanding, Angela, Erin, Angie and Tamara. My daughter is not in daycare at home, so I didn’t know how she would do, but she just loved it. I dropped her off for about an hour the second day of our trip just to see how she would do and she didn’t even look back and didn’t want to leave when I picked her up. Lots of toys, always 2 to 3 GO’s to play with and plenty of other kids to play with, they take two walks a day in strollers, one in the am and one in the pm. Every time I would go peak in on her (more of a separation problem for me) a GO was playing with her, hugging her or giving her a kisses. My schedule would be to drop her off at 9:15, so I could eat breakfast in peace and quiet, pick her up at noon so she could nap in our hotel room, I tried having her nap in the Rascal Room once, but she wouldn’t go down with other kids around, so I opted to take her back to the room everyday. After her nap, I would take her swimming in the baby pool behind the Mini Club for an hour or so. The baby pool was great, we were the only ones in the pool, it was fantastic, it’s only one foot deep, so with her water wings, she could walk around and they have plenty of balls, floats, buckets in the pool to play with. If you do choose to use the baby pool, make sure you wear an old swim suit, I ruined the bottoms on two new swimsuits while scooting around chasing my daughter. The bottom of the pool is a textured concrete. I would then bring her back to the Rascal room around 3:30ish and she would stay until about 5:00. The highlight of the week was the show the Mini Club puts on in the Theater, it was a riot. The best part was seeing my stepson tell everyone in his group that his baby sister was going to be in the show.
reviews.title: Loved Club Med Sandpiper!

reviews.text: We didn’t really utilize the Siesta Service, which is $20 per child from 6 pm – 12pm. They have a free night, which is Tuesday, we used it for an hour to eat dinner in peace. If there is action, my daughter won’t go down, so it didn’t really work for us.

reviews.text: you might want to consider skipping this place. Given the price we paid for this vacation, it was disappointing.

My wife and son went here after a few days at Disney World. She booked the trip, noting some very terrible reviews on this site and a bunch of favorable ones. Do not be fooled. The golf experience at this place is fantastic, but everything else is at the hotel's convenience: they will not go out of their way to assist you, distances are great, and food hours are strictly-maintained. They do not care about you. My family never did get a dysfunctional rear-door lock repaired; they were told to use the chain lock!!! How many places even still HAVE chain locks? The last night they were there the air conditioner malfunctioned, apparently outgassing freon-like vapors, leaving my son, especially, somnulent enough so that there was difficulty shaking him awake. He even turned a strange shade of yellow for a few hours (no, there are no strange substances associated with this). All very strange, but the staff were largely unconcerned, even though we mainly wanted to make sure it didn't happen to anyone else. This place should be great

reviews.title: The kids and I loved it!
reviews.text: I read all the reviews prior to our trip and when we left for Sandpiper, I had very low expectations. But guess what, I was pleasantly surprised. First, lets talk about the rooms. We were in building E, maybe we were lucky ? but the rooms were very clean, extremely large, perfect for a family of four like us, with a very convenient stroller to go around the location. So, really, nothing to complain about. And for the rest, most of the reviews already said that the food was very good, that was true, and the animation, extraordinary, especially the circus shows at night. So, I am back and I am still a Club Med fan. My only disappointment was that, well, I am French-speaking and I choose Club Med partly because of that. Well, this Club Med is very much oriented to an american clientele so the animation was all english. This is too bad because if I want an english-speaking club, I can go to Beaches, Superclub and all the others. So my kids did not participate very much to the activities but nonethless, they had a fantastic time watching the shows and they had access to all the same facilities as the mini-clubs kids, so they did not miss much.

We just returned from a week vacation from July 22nd to July 29th so this review is hot off the press!! My husband and I went with our 15 year old daughter and our 11 year old son and we all had a fantastic time!!!
reviews.title: A wonderful time for everyone in our family!!!

likes.liked: — Lots of activities for all age groups. Staff are very friendly and helpful.

reviews.text: First of all the accomodations. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. Some reviews have noted that the rooms are somewhat dated, which is true, but it also means that they are huge and soundproof. We had two adjoining rooms and they were perfect. The grounds themselves were well kept, the four pools were perfect as well all the other facilities.
reviews.title: Great Kids Clubs

likes.disliked: — A bit rundown, hard tiled floors

reviews.title: Great family trip
reviews.text: Next the food. The food was very good with different themes every night (seafood, European etc.) plus a staple of hot dogs and hamburgers for the unadventuresome. There is a lot of food for all three meals and then snacks available throughout the day. We met a lot of wonderful people including the GO's who would sit at your table but other guest as well. It is not 5-star food but very tasty with a lot of variety.(including frogs legs, alligator, snails etc for the adventuresome). It does have the normal stuff like steaks, ribs, crab legs, shrimp and so forth.

Next the activities. There are a lot. My 11 year old was almost worn out by the third day (he found the strength to keep going). We may have been fortunate but the group of kids in both of the groups our children joined were wonderful and got along very well. There was a lot of hugging, exchanging of emails and more hugging when we were leaving. My wife and I also joined in some of the activities. I must say the GO's were very patient with me, the beginner water skier, and were helpful in every way.
reviews.title: Go to Club Med -iocre if you like Comfort Inn & Luby's Food
FABULOUS
reviews.text: Finally the atmosphere. The GO's are great, both with kids and aldults. We found the whole place to be friendly. Each night there was a special show that all were worth going to. The trapeze was amazing with even some of the guest joining in. When your spouse asks you while you are playing black jack on casino night "where are the children" and your answer is "dancing on stage in the bar with their GO's" you know you are having a good time.

aka: Club Med Sandpiper Bay Hotel Port Saint Lucie
description: NEWLY RENOVATED! Discover the Floridian charm in our renovated all-inclusive family resort of Sandpiper, nestled by the Saint Lucie River which provides fun and excitement on the beach or on sailboats. Travel to Club Med Sandpiper Bay with your family and enjoy a carefree all-inclusive vacation amidst a full-amenity resort where families can discover incomparable sports and children's programs. Make the most of your vacation to discover tennis, golf and fitness with our top coaches in the Club Med Academies.
